programme.desc: CJ Stroud threw for 345 yards and two touchdowns, capped by a 1-yard pass to third-string running back Dare Ogunbowale with 18 seconds left, to give the Texans the 24-20 victory.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Browns running back Nick Chubb scored a 2-yard, go-ahead touchdown with 57 seconds left, and Steelers quarterback Russell Wilson's Hail Mary attempt was batted down in the end zone as time expired as Cleveland wins in the snow 24-19 over Pittsburgh.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Jalen Hurts tossed two touchdown passes, Dallas Goedert threw those three stiff-arms on a rugged TD catch and the Eagles rode their NFL-best defense to a 22-10 wild-card playoff win Sunday night.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: MVP candidates Lamar Jackson and Josh Allen take the field in the AFC Divisional Round, Buffalo prevails on a dropped two-point conversion by Mark Andrews to win 27-25 over the Baltimore Ravens.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Saquon Barkley dashed through the snow for two touchdown runs and finished with 205 yards rushing, Jalen Hurts had a 44-yard scoring run and the Eagles held on against the turnover-happy Rams 28-22 on Sunday to reach the NFC championship game.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Sam Darnold leads the Minnesota Vikings to 5-0 in London against Aaron Rodgers and the New York Jets in London, 23-17. Rodgers threw 3 INT's on the day before getting twisted up awkwardly while getting tackled by several Vikings defenders.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Browns running back Nick Chubb scored a 2-yard, go-ahead touchdown with 57 seconds left, and Steelers quarterback Russell Wilson's Hail Mary attempt was batted down in the end zone as time expired as Cleveland wins in the snow 24-19 over Pittsburgh.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: New England Patriots had rookie QB Drake Maye back after being knocked out of last week's win over the Jets and used his legs, running for a career-best and team-high 95 yards. The Pats had a final chance after Maye forced overtime with a 5-yard TD pass to Rhamondre Stevenson, but Amani Hooker's second interception of the game clinched the victory for the Titans with 2:07 left.

programme.title: 2025 Golden Stick Award Race
programme.desc: The Golden Stick Award is an award given to the player who accumulates the most scoring points throughout the Championship Series. In its history, the winner has been on the team who lost the championship title. This year we followed four of the best goal scorers in the world through their quest to be the first player to win the Championship Series trophy and the Golden Stick Award.

programme.title: 2025 Lexus Championship Series
programme.desc: WLL: New York Charging vs Boston Guard from February 15, 2025

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome back to episode #15 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show on TLN! The field is set! Did Army get hosed? Did Ohio State get hosed based on their draw? The boys fill out their brackets to see who will come out on top. We then move to the PLL Draft. While CJ Kirst going #1 was no surprise, there were some names that took longer to come off the board than expected. The boys name their All-Star, Sleeper, and Snub from this years 2025 PLL Draft.

This year we followed four of the best goal scorers in the world through their quest to be the first player to win the Championship Series trophy and the Golden Stick Award.

programme.title: Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show
programme.desc: Welcome back to episode #15 of the Mitchell Pehlke Lacrosse Show on TLN! The field is set! Did Army get hosed? Did Ohio State get hosed based on their draw? The boys fill out their brackets to see who will come out on top. We then move to the PLL Draft. While CJ Kirst going #1 was no surprise, there were some names that took longer to come off the board than expected. The boys name their All-Star, Sleeper, and Snub from this years 2025 PLL Draft.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: Pot-Limit Omaha returns, as does Lou Garza with the chip lead. Garza looks for retribution in Event #9 ahead of Sean Winter, Miles Rampel, Jeremy Ausmus, and Ben Lamb as $365,500 awaits the winner.

programme.title: Doubles Poker Championship
programme.desc: Thirty-two of the best professional poker players in the world buy in for $50,000 apiece, but there's a twist. They are then randomly paired off and compete as two-person teams that share the play on each hand. With $1 million in first place prize money at stake, which team will survive the gauntlet of clashing personalities and top shelf competition in a game that's usually a single-minded endeavor?

programme.title: Poker Masters 2023 | Event #4 $10K No-Limit Hold'em
programme.desc: Watch the Event #4: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table at the 2023 Poker Masters here.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The first open event of the 2004 WSOP would see 834 entrants create a prize pool of over $1.5 million. David "Chip" Reese and Erick Lindgren both fell just short of the final table as the United Kingdom's James Vogl enters the final table as chip leader ahead of J.C. Tran, David Chiu, and Shawn Rice as all eyes are on the $400,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: Cruel Ambition
programme.desc: Filmmakers Woodson and Behr seek out local investor Leon to fund their feature film but find themselves blackballed. Thinking their luck has changed when they come upon a jackpot, they find out just how cruel ambition can really be.

programme.title: Counterplot
programme.desc: Hiding out in Puerto Rico from a murder rap and double-crossing lawyer in New York, Brock Miller Brock concocts a plan to catch the real killer.

programme.title: Carmen and Magic

programme.title: The Nightcap
programme.desc: On The Nightcap we explore and question other lifestyles and cultures with an enthusiastic, open mind and hope to leave our viewers happily pondering new perspectives. The show's unique set has a full bar with a rotating cast of bartenders pouring up unique cocktails you can try to replicate at home. Whether it's inviting the most provocative guests to the signature pink couch or hearing your take on controversial topics, the conversations never disappoint. From game night to ordering in munchies, The Nightcap will keep you wanting more. It's sexy, it's risqu, it's everything you wouldn't expect from late-night TV.

programme.title: The Pulse With Bill Anderson
programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. He also reports on the brighter side of life in his regular news series For Goodness' Sake.

programme.title: Family Feud
programme.desc: Steve Harvey assumes the hosting duties for this daytime game show in which five members of one family are pitted against five members of another family. The winning family gets a chance to earn extra cash in a bonus round.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 18 return to the kitchen to face off in two challenges. programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 14 receive a mystery box challenge inspired by the White House garden from former First Lady Michelle Obama. The young cooks must come up with an original recipe that is both healthy and presidential worthy, and the winner will receive a special once-in-a-lifetime opportunity! For the next challenge, Julie Bowen (Modern Family) steps into the MASTERCHEF kitchen to watch the kids make a dish in honor of their moms. Then, its up to the judges to decide which contestant will go home.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team present seasonal highlights from across the country, visit stunning gardens, meet the gardeners and find out their secrets of success. Monty, Nigel and Nellie are at Longmeadow, discussing the weekend's gardening jobs.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The team present seasonal highlights from across the country, visiting stunning gardens, meeting the gardeners and finding out their secrets of success. At Longmeadow, Monty, Nigel and Nellie discuss the essential gardening jobs for this weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty, Nigel and Nellie are at Longmeadow, providing inspiration for gardens and discussing all the essential gardening jobs for this weekend.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty has plenty of ideas of how to fill the weekend, from potting on seedlings to sowing tender vegetables. Rachel de Thame reviews the progress of her new kitchen garden and begins planting out peas and sowing flower seeds.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is planning ahead and planting autumn-flowering crocus at Longmeadow. Also for autumn colour, he's adding cyclamen to the spring garden, and has tips on how to get a great show from them. Meanwhile, Joe Swift visits Marks Hall - a surprising but inspiring modern garden and Carol Klein is in Staffordshire with a couple who've created a garden for all seasons in their half-acre plot.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As part of his planning for summer Monty begins to sow annual climbers and gets started on tidying and mulching his borders. In the last of Joe Swift's series on trees, he learns how and when to prune them, and why. We also meet clematis enthusiast, Mike Brown, whose collection fills his garden with colour all summer long, and amongst the brutalist architecture of London's Barbican, Nick Bailey, head gardener of the Chelsea Physic Garden, discovers a hidden tropical oasis.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at RHS Garden Wisley in Surrey to learn from the experts there how easy alpines are to grow, which seeds are needed to plant a wildflower meadow and the best orchids to grow for each room in the house. Meanwhile, Carol Klein helps Britain in Bloom volunteer Michael Welsh, who is determined to bring colour to the former colliery town of Easington with a community garden.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: A single mum of two in Redditch, Holly's garden has turned into a virtual jungle. Can the intrepid threesome come up with a plan to give this family a safe and fun place to play?

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich start with a clean slate in Rutland, and come to the aid of Manjinder. She wants to create an interactive and colourful space to pass her love of gardening on to her two small nephews. Can the team make it happen on her small budget?

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and the Rich Brothers travel to Andover. Animal-lover Sue would like to share her garden with the hedgehogs who live in the neighbourhood, so which designer will create a space both safe and beautiful?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. He also cuts back pelargoniums that have overwintered in the greenhouse and makes a start on sowing vegetables. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Northamptonshire and shows how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don grows a plant he's never tried before, loofahs. He also celebrates some of his favourite tulip combinations and plants out crocosmia. Joe Swift visits a garden, created by an award-winning designer.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at RHS Garden Wisley in Surrey to learn from the experts there how easy alpines are to grow, which seeds are needed to plant a wildflower meadow and the best orchids to grow for each room in the house. Meanwhile, Carol Klein helps Britain in Bloom volunteer Michael Welsh, who is determined to bring colour to the former colliery town of Easington with a community garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the growing season picks up a pace, Monty is sowing vegetables and planting out the scented plants, which he brought back from the Malvern Spring Festival. Carol is delving into the hedgerows and rooting at the bases of walls, fences and trees as she begins her journey to investigate why plants thrive in challenging conditions. We also return to Sissinghurst to find out about the changes Troy Scott-Smith is making to the world famous white garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don shows us how to plant pots of bulbs for fabulous summer colour. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is out and about looking at native celandines, Wordsworth's favourite flower. They grace our hedgerows and woods at this time of year. The wild strains are too invasive for most domestic gardens, but Carol finds a number of cultivated varieties that should suit most of us.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty plants out some tender plants, takes cuttings from herbs and sows carrots. From her garden in Devon, Carol Klein goes back to the basics of propagating your own plants when she shows how to take cuttings.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Join Monty at Longmeadow for an indulgent, horticultural romp through the `Gardeners' World' archives and a joyous riot of colour as we celebrate some of our most beloved summer flowers. From Delphiniums to Clematis, Irises and Dahlias expert growers share their passion along with hints and tips. Carol Klein visits a garden in Worcestershire where she discovers picture perfect peonies.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty shows how to pot tomatoes on to the next stage of their growth. Adam Frost has ideas of transforming a part of his garden into a seating area using a few logs and plants.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty adds a variety of herbs that thrive in shade to the herb garden and adds summer annuals to the cottage garden. Nick Bailey has taken a rare opportunity to design his town garden from scratch.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty plants out tender vegetables for late summer harvests and gives tips on plants that thrive on a minimum of water when he plants up a pot of succulent plants. Frances Tophill demonstrates an unusual method of reducing weeds in her allotment.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gives tips on growing tomatoes and has ideas of how to fill gaps in the garden once the flowers of spring are past their best. The team meet an extraordinary gardener from Swansea, whose upper limb difference has not deterred her.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don reveals plans for a new raised seating area, surrounded by wild flowers. Carol looks at the blossom at Battsford Arboretum in the Cotswolds and now the risk of frosts should have passed, Monty plants beans and courgettes in the vegetable garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a vine to grow dessert grapes and looks at varieties that can be grown outside as well as in a greenhouse. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at home in Glebe Cottage where she reveals a little of the fascinating history of one of our spring favourites, Trillium grandiflorum. Plus, Rachel de Thame explores a suburban, hidden garden with charms all of its own.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the season well underway, there's plenty of work to be getting on with in the garden at Longmeadow and there's plenty to enjoy too. Monty Don will be undertaking some timely tasks to make sure the garden remains beautiful and productive all summer long. Joe Swift visits a garden transported, lock, stock and barrel to Britain from Japan around a hundred years ago.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets to work in his wildlife garden to ensure that there are plenty of plants in flower for early pollinators. Carol Klein meets Stuart Donachie who has embraced every planting opportunity in his shady garden in Herefordshire, and Frances Tophill invites viewers to grow easy summer vegetables along with her as she trials varieties for taste and productivity at RHS Rosemoor.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don looks ahead to the long Easter weekend by cutting back his grass borders. Meanwhile, Joe Swift reveals his top tips for creating a natural garden, and Carol Klein travels to Cornwall in search of a garden full of spring colour. Plus, the `living catalogue' of new and existing varieties of bedding plants at Ball Colegrave in Banbury, Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: With two little ones and a home renovation going on, Cardiff couple Nadine and Steve have paid little attention to their spacious garden. Can Charlie and the boys come up with design ideas that blend entertaining spaces and room for growing children?

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Music-loving couple Paul and Victoria welcome Charlie and the Rich Brothers to their retro-styled home in Coventry. With an original Anderson shelter in place and its owners bursting with imagination, this space is ready for a creative makeover.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie and the Rich Brothers meet Arvinder and Yolanda, a couple juggling older parents, twin babies and busy careers. Their garden has fallen into disrepair, so the team heads to south London to make a space where the family can stop and reflect.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don revels in his passion for roses as he sets about planting some bare root varieties in the Jewel Garden at Longmeadow in readiness for a colourful spring and summer. Continuing the rose theme, there is an inspirational visit to the magnificent formal rose garden of Hever Castle in Kent, home to a breathtaking collection of hybrid teas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a vine to grow dessert grapes and looks at varieties that can be grown outside as well as in a greenhouse. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at home in Glebe Cottage where she reveals a little of the fascinating history of one of our spring favourites, Trillium grandiflorum. Plus, Rachel de Thame explores a suburban, hidden garden with charms all of its own.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: The first signs of spring herald the start of the new gardening year. Monty Don reveals the changes he has made to his garden over the winter, tackles timely pruning tasks and shows the best way to lay a new path. Meanwhile, snowdrops are lighting up the winter garden and Carol Klein is out and about in Oxfordshire celebrating their staggering diversity.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: British summer time means that, from Saturday, we all have an extra hour to get out in our gardens in the evenings just as the early spring display is coming into its own. At Longmeadow, Monty Don introduces us to the coppice, a woodland area where his favourite flower, the primrose, is in bloom. As well as enjoying the seasonal colours of spring, it's time to plan the summer display. Monty sows sweet peas.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: At Longmeadow, Monty shows how to prune spring-flowering roses and makes successional sowings of vegetables to ensure continuous crops. Adam Frost gives tips on helping plants cope with drought conditions and shows how to save precious water.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt heads to Nebraska to talk to the experts at Hornady ammunition and get their take and what the best calibers are for whitetail deer hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: David Blanton heads to Mississippi to hunt his friend Richard Reid's property. Setting up in the dark proves to make the difference as the birds fly down into the field!

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: We were honored to be a part of the Gold Star Youth Outdoors Turkey Hunt at Iron Horse Farms in Alabama. Cole Barthel and Bryan Brown were able to get Charlie Willington his first turkey. Be sure to check out Gold Star Youth Outdoors and Iron Horse Farms.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff embark on a 20-day mission into the Everglades to find the invasive pythons that are plaguing the ecosystem. These apex predators have eliminated more than 90% of fur-bearing animals in their new home. Can they turn the tide, or is the Everglades already lost?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff get bit by catfish in Southern Oklahoma with YouTuber Nate Williams of Adrenaline Rush Adventures while using the most primitive fishing tactic - hand fishing. Learn from the Chickasaw Nation about the history of this method that has been used by Native Americans for thousands of years.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff dive into the wild waters off Hawaiis coast, coming face-to-face with sharks and graceful manta rays. The adrenaline peaks when Kyle takes a heart-pounding leap off a towering 40-foot cliff, making this adventure as daring as it is unforgettable.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel are on a week long mission to find the ducks in the central flyway. The weather is starting to push the ducksdown in to TX and OK but the heavy rainfall has spread them out. It takes constant scouting and adapting to the changes each day to stay on the ducks in order to shoot limits.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting are taking turns filming and hunting Mule Deer in Colorado where they both harvest big mature Colorado bucks with Browning 6.8 Westerns at long range. They leave Colorado and go to Nebraska to hunt with Heritage Outfitters and double up on two great spots and stalk bucks.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting team up with a crew from Simmons Sporting Goods and head west to chase the Wild Turkey! Good times, Good Friends and Great Hunting make for an awesome Spring hunting trip.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nestled in the hills of Ohio just west of the Appalachians is a very special deer camp ripe with memories from deer seasons past. With the development of the 350 Legend straight-walled cartridge by Winchester in 2019, a world of opportunities now existed in states like Ohio and Michigan. In this episode, with the 350 Legend in hand, three mature whitetails meet their maker, from the same blind, over the course of three seasons.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Its been 60 years since AA Tracker was introduced to the shooting sports world. Since that day, an immeasurable number of AA hulls have hit the ground and countless shooters have stood center stage raising a trophy where millions of dollars have been won. Professional and recreational shooters alike have trusted AA for six decades. In this episode, load up for stories of high school, collegiate competitors and the worlds best as they bust clays with the legendary shot shell.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: For the first time in history, the World English Sporting Clays Championship was held in the United States at the incredible M&M Hunting Preserve owned by the Matarese family in New Jersey. Watch as Winchesters best shooters vie for Gold as they compete against over 2,500 shooters and 17 countries. Well also join the Kids and Clays foundation in Florida as they host an event that will most certainly touch your soul.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team is taking the Marine Surplus Console for the Aqua sport project and giving it a much needed face lift. They meet the team at Boat Outfitters to find an acrylic covering board to fit the console and cover the pre existing holes. They then head over to meet with crew at AwlGrip to get some ideas on color matching the console with the Aqua sport.

programme.title: Global Getaway
programme.desc: This week on Getaway, we are cruising the islands of the Caribbean on board a luxury super yacht. From Antigua to Martinique, St Lucia to the Grenadines, its a picture perfect paradise.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish shes never caught before. Lo and behold, its a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Saltwater Experience
programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor meet up with Captain Nick LaBadie at Big Pine Key for an action packed day on the flats chasing tarpon, bonefish and permit for the elusive grand slam.

programme.desc: Captains Tom Rowland and Rich Tudor run from Hawks Cay Resort up to Islamorada on a windy day to fish under the mangroves for Goliath grouper.

programme.title: Behind the Draw
programme.desc: Mike makes a wild stalk on a beautiful velvet mule deer buck. The entire week was a week to remember filled with many ups and downs. We can't thank our buddy Cody enough for inviting us out! Don't miss Part 1 of this epic Montana bowhunt!

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Father/son duo Brad and Noah Rucks are after the same giant whitetail that's making regular appearances on their family farm.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson closes out the half way point on the South America Waterfowl Slam. On just the third day of the hunt, he is able to take a Chilean Wigeon and a Rosy Billed Pochard which make species number 9 and 10 of the 20 on his list. Mark is still sharing the blind with Matt Gindorff, a WTA consultant, and they discuss waterfowl hunting in Argentina and how it compares to that of the U.S.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake and a fellow guide search for redfish along the beach, but Mother Nature has other ideas and gives them a show they didnt expect.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: For Capt. Justin Leake, sight fishing the beach is one of the most productive, and FUN ways to fish. When that doesnt work, Capt. Todd Jones suggests fishing an artificial reef, and as it turns out, thats where dinner lives.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Meredith McCord arrives in late spring and joins Capt. Justin Leake on the hunt for a fish shes never caught before. Lo and behold, its a day fit for a king.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: With Meredith McCord halfway around the world, Capt. Justin Leake gives show producer Chris Hermans his first shot at landing a tarpon after filming them for 9 seasons. Does art imitate life?

programme.title: FinQuest Outdoors
programme.desc: In the premiere of FinQuest, freshwater pro Ryan Miller dives into the world of saltwater fishing in Florida. Guided by Alex Burgess, Ryan tackles sailfish and tuna while mastering kite fishing. The adventure continues with his family as they enjoy a thrilling hydrofoil ride in Jupiter, Florida, blending fishing excitement with family fun on the water.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryans passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate outside in Palm Beach County FL.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captain Scott Walker fishes out of Hawks Cay with fellow Duck Key resident Captain Ariel Medero catching Blackfin Tunas and big Queen Snappers.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger chase the full moon Wahoo bite fishing out of Plantation Boat Mart.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captain Scott Walker heads swordfishing out of Hawks Cay with his friend, retired WWE wrestler Travis Tomko.

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Ariel Medero fish with David Moss from the Nature Conservancy out of Hawks Cay sampling the bottom fishing and deep dropping. In between the action they learn about the Nature Conservancys mission to promote sustainable and transparent fishing practices.

programme.title: Into The Blue
programme.desc: Captains Scott Walker and Steve Rodger break in Plantation Boat Marts new 36 Invincible with some muttons for dinner and an epic shallow water sailfish double.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Part one of Mike and Beth's adventure to Costa Rica's Zancudo Lodge.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Trevor pack up and drive down to Arkansas for their first experience on the White River. The brothers spend a day in the boat with Bryant Stark of Rising Rivers, fishing the White and the Norfork. Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton makes a trip to South Carolina to fish Lake Murray. He meets up with the Rather Outdoors crew to spend time on the water and at the Rather HQ checking out all the gear from Lews and Strike King.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: Lake St. Francis hosts the BaitFuel Fishing Tour Teams for Qualifier 4 of the 2023 series.

programme.title: Baitfuel Fishing Tournament
programme.desc: The final qualifier takes place out of Cardinal, Ontario on the mighty St. Lawrence River.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP DeRose and his tournament partner's daughter, Caylan target White Sturgeon in British Columbia

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries
programme.desc: JP is joined by Capt. Richard White, targeting Yellowfin Tuna on light spinning setups at Tropic Star Lodge.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. Thats where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredientsfrom sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintans kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float planea new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, the land of earth, sea, and sky. All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaskas abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. Therell be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for nowjoin usthere are halibut to filet, rainforest shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Anyone can be a cowboythats the biggest thing the DIRT crew learned in Texas. From riding bulls in Fort Worth to off-roading in the Chihuahuan desert to forging their own path across this vast state with the help of local trailblazers Liz and Lou Lambert. Lucky for us, they even stopped by Huckberrys own backyard in Austin for a quick ruck and a couple games of chicken sh*t bingo. When the dust finally settled, we fired up the barbecue for our beefiest feast yet and raised our ranch waters high to 10 DIRT episodes in the can.

programme.title: Silver Kings
programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins marketing genius & super talented photographer Dylan Schmitz for a day in Islamorada.

programme.title: Silver Kings

programme.desc: Editor-n-Chief Dan Schmidt unravels the social structure of the whitetail doe community. Meanwhile, already tagged out on a big buck in Texas, outdoor writer Brad Fenson turns his sights onto mature does.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Mark Kayser in in Montana as the whitetail rut is dying down, thankfully for him, his tag is good for whitetail or mule deer.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: Randy and Cody are wrapping things up on the Raven before bow season arrives in Missouri. Planting I-70 the plot where Randy killed one of his biggest Missouri bucks ever last year. Then Randy and Cody attempt to setup a new farm they are calling The River Farm they attempt to plant a food plot, bush hog, spray the plot, setup a new Titan blind, and setup a Hooyman dual perimeter fence all in one day before the sun goes down.

programme.title: The Raven Project
programme.desc: The boys are at the Dirty Bird in Oklahoma trying to run some trot lines on the North Canadian river but the water is just a little lower than they expected.

programme.title: The Direction
programme.desc: This week we join professional angler, Andrew Nordbye, for a cold day on Guntersville to catch some giant crappie; traveling through a major winter storm and arriving at an abandoned lake was the not-surprising scene for the day. Andrew's priorities are in order when it comes to his marriage, his faith, and his family, including just-arrived new babies...but he sill made time to squeeze in this day on water with us!

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt heads to Nebraska to talk to the experts at Hornady ammunition and get their take and what the best calibers are for whitetail deer hunting.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed for the opportunity to follow along the guys from Trinity Oaks for Bucks for the Brave. The men and women that served in our armed services and as first responders, had jobs that required the, to be willing to sacrifice their own lives every day, in order to protect or save someone else's. Not many of us can say that, nor understand what that truly means. The things they've had to see, and the sacrifices they've made in their daily lives, can have a profound impact on them. Trinity Oaks' Bucks for the Brave platform allows the loved ones and communities that support these heroes to share their stories and unite us all in honoring and recognizing their service to our great nation. We are proud to continue to be a part of this incredible program, getting these heroes in the outdoors for the hunt of a lifetime.

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: David Blanton heads to Mississippi to hunt his friend Richard Reid's property. Setting up in the dark proves to make the difference as the birds fly down into the field!

programme.title: Spring Thunder
programme.desc: We were honored to be a part of the Gold Star Youth Outdoors Turkey Hunt at Iron Horse Farms in Alabama. Cole Barthel and Bryan Brown were able to get Charlie Willington his first turkey. Be sure to check out Gold Star Youth Outdoors and Iron Horse Farms.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode Slade and the old Trained Assassins (TAT) crew head to Montrose, Colorado where they meet up with Slades dad, Bear Cub, TJ, and George for a heck of a week at Elk Camp. This is all going on now on Hunting Land Man TV.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to the back, back-country where even the fish struggle to find water.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike tries to hold his own while fishing with Nick Fischer and Liza Fitzgerald in south seas Captiva. Good luck buddy.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff embark on a 20-day mission into the Everglades to find the invasive pythons that are plaguing the ecosystem. These apex predators have eliminated more than 90% of fur-bearing animals in their new home. Can they turn the tide, or is the Everglades already lost?

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff get bit by catfish in Southern Oklahoma with YouTuber Nate Williams of Adrenaline Rush Adventures while using the most primitive fishing tactic - hand fishing. Learn from the Chickasaw Nation about the history of this method that has been used by Native Americans for thousands of years.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff dive into the wild waters off Hawaiis coast, coming face-to-face with sharks and graceful manta rays. The adrenaline peaks when Kyle takes a heart-pounding leap off a towering 40-foot cliff, making this adventure as daring as it is unforgettable.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle and Jeff explore the breathtaking Waipio Valley, the Hawaiian "Valley of the Kings," in search of prawns and bullfrogs. Their adventure continues up a massive volcano, hunting invasive rams, before ending with a feast of native fish paired with island fruits and spices.

programme.title: Sail Kings

programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins his long time friend Capt. Jake Roth for a day of fishing in the Florida Keys.

programme.desc: Zach heads back to the homeland to hunt mule deer with a bow in North Dakota.

programme.desc: The Crew hunts the Indiana farm to chase one of the mature bucks that call the farm home.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Carson and Zach chase big honkers and mallards in a dry field in their back yard in Indiana.

programme.desc: Danny tries his hand at being a guide on the Manistee River with Koz. Then later Danny tries his fly fishing skills on the Crystal River to see if he can land a monster salmon on the fly.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny brings his buddy Ryan to Port St. Joe for scalloping season. They hook up with Guillermo from Blacks Island to show them how its done.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny is joined by Ryan Sheffield for some fishing on Cape San Blas. They meet up with Mark Moore to go fishing for Reds and Trout. Later, they cook up the catch.

programme.title: The Reel American Road Trip
programme.desc: Danny is joined by John McCune for blue line fishing with Tad Murdock. Later they explore Helen Georgia during Oktoberfest.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Part of our North Dakota crew joins us in Illinois to shoot green heads in The Land of Lincoln.

programme.title: Wentz Brother's Outdoors
programme.desc: Zach and Carson Wentz head home to North Dakota to chase geese, ducks, and pheasants.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel are on a week long mission to find the ducks in the central flyway. The weather is starting to push the ducksdown in to TX and OK but the heavy rainfall has spread them out. It takes constant scouting and adapting to the changes each day to stay on the ducks in order to shoot limits.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting are taking turns filming and hunting Mule Deer in Colorado where they both harvest big mature Colorado bucks with Browning 6.8 Westerns at long range. They leave Colorado and go to Nebraska to hunt with Heritage Outfitters and double up on two great spots and stalk bucks.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Kyle Barefield and Cole Barthel from All Things Hunting team up with a crew from Simmons Sporting Goods and head west to chase the Wild Turkey! Good times, Good Friends and Great Hunting make for an awesome Spring hunting trip.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As the SoCal Bluefin Tuna fishing season begins to take shape, Ali and Rush head out to fish the waters of San Diego and see what new surprises may be in store for them this year. For many boats in the fleet, the heading turns to the south for a visit to the commercial tuna pen operation that often attracts other fish from miles away. It's parking lot fishing at its best, but with a change in technique and break from the crowd Ali puts Rush on the bite!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: When it comes to fishing and the marine industry, we are often more united by the Bluefin tuna than we think. For Ali Hussainy, the Bluefin is responsible for fueling his life long passion as an angler, and in this episode he gets to share that passion with two friends that have their own ties to the species. For wildlife biologist Forrest Galante and master sushi chef Hiroyuki Terada, catching a bluefin tuna on rod and reel will be a first!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Over a decade after the game changing Longbeard XR was introduced by Winchester, the wait is finally over for their next ground breaking turkey load. After years of perfecting the recipe behind the scenes, Winchester finally unveiled the new Longbeard TSS at a turkey camp in northern Michigan. First watch the jaw dropping Longbeard TSS pattern board testing, then see it go to work on some spring gobblers.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun

programme.title: FinQuest Outdoors
programme.desc: In the premiere of FinQuest, freshwater pro Ryan Miller dives into the world of saltwater fishing in Florida. Guided by Alex Burgess, Ryan tackles sailfish and tuna while mastering kite fishing. The adventure continues with his family as they enjoy a thrilling hydrofoil ride in Jupiter, Florida, blending fishing excitement with family fun on the water.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: In Episode 6 of FinQuest, Ryan Miller dives into the vibrant world of offshore fishing off the coast of Palm Beach County. Joined by Cabo Mike and Chi Lui they showcase expert bait techniques and strategies for trolling and reef fishing. The team reels in a variety of fish, including snapper, mackerel, porgy, blue fish. Cabo Mike goes over the hook set ups they used and equipment tips. With breathtaking views of the ocean and a colorful array of fish, Ryans passion for saltwater fishing shines through. The episode wraps up with Ryan meeting up with Mandy & Hawkin to ice skate outside in Palm Beach County FL.

Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: Breaking Boundaries

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: New. York. City. Thats where our host Josh Rosen kicks off his journey in Episode 4and where he lived for 16 years and started up the surf-centric apparel brand, Saturdays NYC. Back in his old stomping grounds, Josh first meets up with the award-winning chef and Mumbai native, Chintan Pandya, currently blowing up the New York food scene with his unapologetic and authentic Indian cuisine (pro tip: try the goat brains). Next, Josh travels through the boroughs, heads upstate, and along the coast to source local ingredientsfrom sake brewers and pig farmers to catching fresh lobster just 100 miles from Wall Street. As always the adventure will end with a feast, right back in Chintans kitchen.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Hop in the float planea new episode of DIRT just dropped. The DIRT crew made their way to Alaska, the land of earth, sea, and sky. All feast, no sleep is the name of the game as Josh makes the most of Alaskas abundant and legendary daylight alongside local guides, fishermen, and even a couple grizzlies. Therell be plenty of time to hibernate in winter. But for nowjoin usthere are halibut to filet, rainforest shrooms to forage, and mountainside meals to cook up.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Anyone can be a cowboythats the biggest thing the DIRT crew learned in Texas. From riding bulls in Fort Worth to off-roading in the Chihuahuan desert to forging their own path across this vast state with the help of local trailblazers Liz and Lou Lambert. Lucky for us, they even stopped by Huckberrys own backyard in Austin for a quick ruck and a couple games of chicken sh*t bingo. When the dust finally settled, we fired up the barbecue for our beefiest feast yet and raised our ranch waters high to 10 DIRT episodes in the can.

programme.title: Higher Ground
programme.desc: After his friend and business partner gets murdered, a retired FBI agent sets out to find out who did it and make them pay for it.

programme.title: Heartsounds
programme.desc: A near-fatal heart attack sends a New York urologist and his writer wife into a battle against a medical institution unable or unwilling to help him.

programme.title: Florence Nightingale
programme.desc: Set in early 1840s Britain, this biopic details the life of Florence Nightingale, who is considered to be the pioneer of modern nursing.

programme.title: Fatal Contact: Bird Flu in America
programme.desc: Follows an Avian Flu outbreak from its origins in a Hong Kong market through its mutation into a transmissible virus among humans around the world.

programme.title: The China Syndrome
programme.desc: A news reporter (Jane Fonda) and her cameraman (Michael Douglas) are unintentional witnesses to a SCRAM incident, an emergency core shutdown procedure at a nuclear power plant in California. The crew prevents a catastrophe, but the plant supervisor (Jack Lemmon) begins to suspect the plant is in violation of safety standards, and tries desperately to bring it to the attention of the public, fearing that another SCRAM incident will produce an atomic disaster.

programme.title: Vertical Limit
programme.desc: Feeling responsible for his father's death, which occurred during a climbing expedition, Peter Garrett (Chris O'Donnell) has quit the pursuit in favor of photography, while his sister, Annie (Robin Tunney), has become a top climber. After Annie is hired by wealthy businessman Elliot Vaughn (Bill Paxton) to lead a trek, inclement weather causes the crew to become trapped. Facing his fears, Peter assembles a rescue team, including experienced climber Montgomery Wick (Scott Glenn), to save them.

programme.title: Into Thin Air: Death on Everest
programme.desc: The compelling and dramatic true story of two teams of hikers as they made their dangerous and fatal ascent on Mt. Everest in early 1996.

programme.title: Final Descent
programme.desc: When his aircraft collides with another plane in midair, Captain Glen "Lucky" Singer must try to save the lives of his 319 passengers.

programme.title: Final Run
programme.desc: On a family trip, Glen "Lucky" Singer must stop a train from careening toward disaster when an engineer's mistake causes a glitch in the controls.

programme.title: Out of Time
programme.desc: While in pursuit of a criminal mastermind, a cop travels back in time and comes face to face with his great-grandfather, who lived 100 years earlier.

programme.title: Nothing in Common
programme.desc: A hilarious comedy about a perpetual adolescent who's forced to deal with his aging, unloving father when his mother leaves him flat.

programme.title: Immediate Family
programme.desc: An upscale couple unable to conceive arrange a brokered adoption with a pregnant woman who doesnt hold up her end of the deal to give up the baby.

programme.title: The Incredible Journey of Doctor Meg Laurel
programme.desc: An intrepid young doctor returns to her roots to open a practice in Appalachia, where her modern medicine clashes with the locals home-spun remedies.

programme.title: Passionada
programme.desc: When a widowed mother refuses to date even years after her husband's death, her daughter Vicky sets out on a quest to find romance for her mom.

programme.title: Nadine
programme.desc: While recovering sexy photos of herself from a dishonest photographer, a woman witnesses a murder and finds herself at the center of a conspiracy.

programme.title: The Principal
programme.desc: After taking a bat to the Porsche of his ex-wifes divorce attorney, teacher Rick Latimer is punished with a principal post at a violent high school.

programme.title: Takers
programme.desc: High-octane thriller about a group of notorious criminals whose streak of untraceable bank heists may come to an end thanks to a hardcore detective.

programme.title: You Were Never Lovelier
programme.desc: Bob Davis (Fred Astaire), an American dancer in Buenos Aires, Argentina, finds himself desperate for work after losing all his money. He takes a gig at a wedding, hoping to impress the bride's father, Eduardo Acua (Adolphe Menjou), a local club owner who has decreed that his daughters must marry in order of age. Eduardo eventually agrees to allow Bob to perform at his club, but only under the condition that he play suitor to his second-oldest daughter, the beautiful Maria (Rita Hayworth).

programme.title: All the Young Men
programme.desc: After taking command of a Marine platoon during the Korean War, a Black sergeant struggles to rally the white soldiers to complete a critical mission.

programme.title: Gidget Grows Up
programme.desc: When her boyfriend leaves for the Air Force without calling, Gidget heads to New York in the name of world peace and joins the U.N. as a tour guide.

programme.title: The Three Stooges in Orbit
programme.desc: When a pair of Martians steal a powerful submarine-tank-rocket military weapon from an inventor, the Three Stooges step in to try to save the day.

programme.title: The Goddess
programme.desc: As a child, she was Emily Ann, a poor girl in the South with no friends and an ineffective mother. But as an adult, she's Rita Shawn (Kim Stanley), an actress loved the world over. Still, all the money and fame in the world can't buy happiness, and Rita is plagued with depression over her broken relationships -- first to a handsome soldier (Steve Hill) and then to a boxing promoter (Lloyd Bridges) -- and her lack of any emotional connections to anyone outside of her professional life.

programme.title: Miss Sadie Thompson
programme.desc: In postwar Honolulu, a former sex worker finds herself courted by a love-struck Marine as a religious zealot sets his sights on reforming her.

programme.title: Drive a Crooked Road
programme.desc: Auto mechanic Mickey must give up his dream of becoming a professional race car driver after he is fooled into being a chump for some gangsters.

programme.title: The Heroes of Telemark
programme.desc: In German-occupied Norway in 1942, a resistance group attempts to sabotage the Nazi's production of essential atomic bomb components.

programme.title: Passport to Suez
programme.desc: Master sleuth Lone Wolf (Warren William) outwits Nazi spies for canal plans in Egypt.

programme.title: Our Man in Havana
programme.desc: A vacuum cleaner salesman is recruited as a spy by the British secret service. Despite his phony reports and lies, he quickly gains importance.

programme.title: Fire Down Below
programme.desc: The long-standing bond between two small-time smugglers sailing around the Caribbean is threatened when a gorgeous siren seeks passage on their boat.

programme.title: The Lone Wolf Takes a Chance
programme.desc: A former jewel thief (Warren William) is accused of murder after betting the police inspector that he can stay out of trouble for 24 hours.

programme.title: The Wackiest Ship in the Army
programme.desc: During WW II, Lt. Rip Crandall and his inexperienced and motley crew get assigned to deliver an Australian observer to a Japanese-held island.

programme.title: Let Us Live
programme.desc: When a confused eyewitness identifies New York City cabbie Brick Tennant (Henry Fonda) as a killer, he is sentenced to death for a murder that he wasn't involved in. Though no one is willing to listen to the innocent prisoner's pleas for freedom, Brick's faithful fiance, Mary (Maureen O'Sullivan), knows that her lover is innocent -- because she was with him when the crime was committed. As the scheduled execution draws ever nearer, Mary begins to investigate the murder herself.

programme.title: Dead Reckoning
programme.desc: A war hero steps off a train and into a world of gambling, blackmail and murder while searching for a fellow vet who inexplicably disappeared himself.

programme.title: The Solid Gold Cadillac
programme.desc: A small stockholder-turned-corporate heroine ousts a crooked Board of Trustees and reinstates an honest director, falling in love along the way.

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: A mute boy who spends his days roaming the English countryside starts coming out of his shell when he befriends a wild pony and a retired colonel.

programme.title: She Played With Fire
programme.desc: An English insurance man (Jack Hawkins) discovers his ex-girlfriend (Arlene Dahl) and her husband's (Dennis Price) art-forgery/arson scam.

programme.title: Duffy
programme.desc: A professional smuggler gets involved in a scheme by two half-brothers to steal a fortune from their wealthy fathers yacht in the Mediterranean.

programme.title: The Last Angry Man
programme.desc: A principled elderly doctor in Brooklyn remains suspicious when his would-be journalist nephew persuades him to let his life story be told on TV.

programme.title: The Mouse That Roared
programme.desc: When a kerfuffle over fine wine exports upends their tiny nation's economy, the prime minister and grand duchess of Fenwick declare war on the U.S.

programme.title: Eight Iron Men
programme.desc: In this psychological war drama, the nerves of eight men wear thin, as they are pinned down for 17 days under heavy bombardment during World War II.

programme.title: Divorce American Style
programme.desc: A nouveau-riche L.A. couple decide to call it quits after 17 years of marriage, but alimony woes send the bachelor in search of a husband for his ex.

programme.title: Her Husband's Affairs
programme.desc: Advertising executive William Weldon (Franchot Tone) narrowly averts career implosion when his clever wife, Margaret (Lucille Ball), helps him save an important advertising account. But tensions run high in the Weldon household after William's fast-talking employer, J.B. Cruikshank (Edward Everett Horton), invites Margaret to work for him too. The cunning couple must compete with each other to write a campaign for Emil Glinka (Mikhail Rasumny) -- a mad scientist with an alarming new product.

programme.title: His Girl Friday
programme.desc: A crafty editor for the Morning Post news uses every trick in the book to keep his fast-talking, ace reporter ex-wife from remarrying her new beau

programme.title: The Nevadan
programme.desc: After fleeing a sheriff's escort to jail, an outlaw thief crosses paths with a mysterious stranger and a greedy rancher en route to his stash of gold.

programme.title: Laramie Mountains
programme.desc: The Durango Kid learns that crooked scouts are behind attempts to escalate a war between a local tribe and the cavalry.

programme.title: The Tall T
programme.desc: The victims must outsmart their cruel captors after an outlaw, and his gang kidnap an heiress, her nervous husband, and a rancher.

programme.title: The Stranger Wore a Gun
programme.desc: After the Civil War, a spy for the Confederacy absconds to Arizona to start a new life but gets reluctantly pulled into a stagecoach gold robbery.

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat
programme.desc: Texan and U.S. Cavalryman Lt. Frank Hewitt (Audie Murphy) deserts the army after Colorado Union soldiers carry out the deadly Sand Creek reservation massacre, fearing reprisal from the Cheyenne. Crossing into Texas, Franks finds himself labeled a traitor for fighting with the Yankees, and his warnings about possible Indian revenge go unheeded. When a town near a mission, populated mostly by women, is attacked, Frank is appointed their protector and must build an army comprised of townswomen.

programme.title: The Domino Kid
programme.desc: A Confederate veteran (Rory Calhoun) hunts to kill the five outlaws who ran off his cattle and shot his father.

programme.title: Massacre Canyon
programme.desc: A cavalry officer and two of his men set out to make sure that a shipment of guns safely reaches its destination.

programme.title: North From the Lone Star
programme.desc: Wild Bill Hickok (Bill Elliott) puts on a badge to clean up a town.

programme.title: The Longest Drive
programme.desc: After a decade apart, a pair of brothers reunites to find their long-lost sister, who was kidnapped as a child and is now living with a native tribe.

programme.title: Whirlwind Raiders
programme.desc: The Durango Kid (Charles Starrett) and his singing sidekick (Smiley Burnette) stop bogus Texas lawmen.

programme.title: A Man Called Sledge
programme.desc: In the Old West, a gunfighting outlaw connives his way into a jail with the goal of stealing a large shipment of gold stored in the prison.

programme.title: Lust for Gold
programme.desc: During the 1870s, the ruthless Jacob Walz (Glenn Ford) becomes very wealthy after locating a legendary Arizona gold mine and securing sole ownership by murdering his partner. Walz then travels to Phoenix, where he catches the attention of a beautiful and crafty woman named Julia Thomas (Ida Lupino), who has learned of his exploits. Eventually, Walz falls in love with Julia, unaware that she's already married to Pete (Gig Young), who is eyeing his fortune.

programme.title: Seminole Uprising
programme.desc: An Army lieutenant (George Montgomery) is ordered to go after Florida Indians in Texas.

programme.title: The Man From Colorado
programme.desc: In Colorado at the end of the Civil War, Col. Owen Devereaux (Glenn Ford), affected by four years of brutal bloodshed, orders the massacre of a Confederate unit, even as they try to surrender. Devereaux's friend and second in command, Capt. Del Stewart (William Holden), is the only one aware of the surrender attempt. Devereaux returns home to a hero's welcome and is appointed a judge, yet his irrational and angry behavior continues, affecting his fiance, Caroline (Ellen Drew), as well as Del.

programme.title: The Outlaw Stallion
programme.desc: A boy and his mother are kidnapped by outlaws after the boy's stallion kills the outlaw leader's mount.

programme.title: The Texas Rangers
programme.desc: The Civil War has ended, the Union Army has pulled out, and now the Texas Rangers are needed once again to protect their state from harm. The newly reformed Rangers decide to take a chance by hiring a notorious outlaw Johnny Carver (George Montgomery). They offer the desperado amnesty for his previous crimes if he'll put his famous trigger finger to work for Texas. Carver agrees, but his new job won't be easy, as his old rival, the Sundance Kid (Ian MacDonald), is out for vengeance.

programme.title: Ride Lonesome
programme.desc: A bounty hunter escorts a killer to prison but allows his outlaw brother to catch up with them to have a showdown over a previous shocking murder.

programme.title: Masterson of Kansas
programme.desc: In the 1870s, Marshal Wyatt Earp (Bruce Cowling) calls upon Dodge City, Kan., Sheriff Bat Masterson (George Montgomery) to track down rancher Merrick (John Maxwell), who is accused of murder. But, thanks to some proof held by local Native American Chief Yellow Hawk (Jay Silverheels), Masterson realizes Merrick might be the victim of a frame-up. So, with the help of Earp and gunfighter Doc Holliday (James Griffith), Masterson sets out to find those who are really behind the killing.

programme.title: Gunmen From Laredo
programme.desc: A framed Texas rancher (Robert Knapp) escapes from prison for a showdown with a saloonkeeper (Walter Coy).

programme.title: Savage Pampas
programme.desc: To tame the plains of Argentina, dominated by bandits and Indigenous warriors, an army captain brings in a party of women to keep his soldiers happy.

programme.title: The Nevadan
programme.desc: After fleeing a sheriff's escort to jail, an outlaw thief crosses paths with a mysterious stranger and a greedy rancher en route to his stash of gold.

programme.title: Laramie Mountains
programme.desc: The Durango Kid learns that crooked scouts are behind attempts to escalate a war between a local tribe and the cavalry.

programme.title: Buck and the Preacher
programme.desc: A trail guide who protects former slaves and a con-man join forces against bounty hunters hired to drive the former slaves back into the south.

programme.title: Conquest of Cochise
programme.desc: A cavalry major (Robert Stack) sides with Apache chief Cochise (John Hodiak) against Comanches after the Gadsden Purchase.

programme.title: Cyclone Fury
programme.desc: The Durango Kid puts the skids on a bandit bent on sabotaging an Indian's bid for a government contract.

programme.title: Gun Fury
programme.desc: California-bound rancher Ben Warren (Rock Hudson) is shot and left for dead when a demented ex-Confederate, Frank Slayton (Phil Carey), kidnaps his Southern bride-to-be (Donna Reed). Revived, Ben sets out to rescue her. Along the way, he picks up Jess Burgess (Leo Gordon), a slighted former member of Slayton's gang, and American Indian local Johash (Pat Hogan), who has his own beef with the outlaws. Together they embark on a perilous chase toward the Mexican border to stop Slayton.

programme.title: Kazan
programme.desc: A Canadian government wildlife expert (Stephan Dunne) tames a white dog trained to fight by brutal masters.

programme.title: Count Three and Pray
programme.desc: After fighting for the Union during the Civil War, Luke Fargo (Van Heflin) is greeted with resentment when he returns home to his small southern town. Luke has a reputation as a rogue, but he's reinvented himself as a man of God and plans to fix up the town's damaged church. Recalling their romantic past, Georgina Decrais (Allison Hayes) tries to reclaim Luke. But, to the dismay of some suspicious townspeople, he concentrates on mentoring an unsophisticated young woman, Lissy (Joanne Woodward).

programme.title: Stage to Tucson
programme.desc: Trouble-shooters (Rod Cameron, Wayne Morris) track Arizona stagecoaches hijacked for sale to the Confederacy.

programme.title: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Jed Cooper (Victor Mature), a trapper, enlists as an army fort scout, and shortly after meets and falls for Corinna Marston (Anne Bancroft), the wife of a nearby fort's commander. Jed comes across her husband, Col. Marston (Robert Preston), after he's suffered an attack at the hands of Native Americans. Col. Marston forces the captain of Jed's fort, Glenn Riordan (Guy Madison), to send out Jed and the troops to fight his attackers, despite their lack of battle experience.

programme.title: Truth
programme.desc: When a reporter is killed while investigating a story, her college friend and a former professor join forces to try and find out who murdered her.

programme.title: Ties that Bind
programme.desc: Detective takes in her jailed brothers unruley teenagers whilst looking after her own and solving crime.

programme.title: What Happened Last Night
programme.desc: Two college students, Danny and Sarah, are strangers until they wake up together after a night of partying.

programme.title: Inspiring Love
programme.desc: When Islas art unexpectedly sells to Mark, a second commission sees them falling in love.

programme.title: Eat, Love, London
programme.desc: Stella takes a job at a new London restaurant and ends up falling for the chef.

programme.title: New Dogs, Old Tricks
programme.desc: It's the day of the Gamma Fair, but Sarah doesn't want to go. Bundy rescues Kappa Psi Psi's bachelorette auction, but pays for it later.

programme.title: New Dogs, Old Tricks
programme.desc: Tiny receives notice that his bar will close unless he pays $17,000 and his customers rally around him with a plan to save it; meanwhile Jay's hazing practices start to raise red flags.

programme.title: For the Love of Lily
programme.desc: A career-minded city girl must build a garden with a plant-loving country boy to appease her boss.

programme.desc: A local moms and dads group clash for the prestigious Modern Parenting Group of the Year award.

programme.title: Scented with Love
programme.desc: Paris-trained perfumer Rosalie is forced to share her new store space with furniture maker Jason.

programme.title: My Mother's Stalker
programme.desc: A single mother gets more than she bargained for, when she decides to spice up her life by meeting up with an obsessive old high school flame.

programme.desc: The accidental sale of an heirloom lands an amateur jeweler a position in Miamis biggest jewelry company working alongside the CEOs too-serious son.
